content.description: Fun easy slab above a kind of sketchy landing, just be sure not to fall
content.protection: Maybe you could place pads here, better to just not fall
content.location: Just past the down climb, right above a small waterfall.  Start off the farthest rock you can stand on

content.description:
Fun slab that eventually steepens up to vertical climbing on small crimps and edges.  I believe it was originally rated 5.7, but is usually bouldered.

There is one bolt w/ hanger at the top of this climb if you feel like roping up.
content.protection: Pads would seem useless because a fall would result in sliding down or bouncing off the bottom slab well before actually hitting the ground.  Just don't fall or bring a TR for the one lonely bolt.
content.location: On the south side of the Zodiac Boulder on the big prominent face.  Right of the water climbs and left of the tree.

content.description: Start on the blue spray painted undercling and move straight up on good edges.
content.location: North side of the Zodiac boulder, above the Play Boys graffiti.

content.description: Awesome route pulling on beautiful edges up the zodiac boulder.  This climb sites immediately left of Lode Stone.  I've started it by traversing in slightly from the right of going straight up the blank slab.  Either way, get to the headwall of cool edges and straight up to the top
content.protection: There is a boulder that you would bounce off if you fell, so pad the boulder and below and spot from below.  The first time I did it, I asked my spotter as I was up on the thin headwall, "What if I fall?".  He replied and said, "...Just don't fall".  Bad question - Good advice.
content.location: On the SE face of the zodiac boulder. I think there's some spray paint near the bottom.

content.description: Lodestone is a beautiful route up the zodiac boulder.  Start on the right side of the main face of zodiac and go up to the lode stone either dynamic or static.  From here go straight up using the arête staying on the same face.
content.protection: Last time I checked, a fallen log was hovering above the landing zone about 3' making it an interesting fall.
content.location: On the far right of the main face of the zodiac boulder. Can be identified by the big round cobble about 15' up.

content.description:
Starts just next to spray painted Bunny, sit start off the crescent shaped edge.

Move right and up on small edges.
content.location: North side of the Zodiac boulder, to the right of the car axle, near the Bunny.

content.description:
Sit start with left hand undercling beneath the blocky shelf and right hand on crimpy edge. Powerful moves through pinches and other decent holds. Continue straight up from the pocket, using sidepulls along the seam.

The physical crux is low and easy to protect, but a fall past the midpoint would probably result in a painful landing on the axle or other big rocks.
content.protection: One pad for the low crux. Several pads and a spotter to be as safe as possible for the upper half of the climb.
content.location: Just to the left of the axle on the Zodiac boulder

content.description: Start next to the down climb on chest height holds and traverse the boulder to the left, until you reach Beach Face. Top out Beach Face to complete.
content.location: Traverse the North Side of the boulder, starting just left of the down climb.

content.description: Climb straight up, then trending left near the top.
content.location: Starts over the word "Boys", just right of the start for "Play Boys"

content.description: With your right hand on some small cobbles, work up through edges and dishes.
content.location: Just right of the car axle.

content.description: Start standing on the car axle and go straight up the face.
content.protection: Pads, spotter. Probably best not to fall.
content.location: On the North side of the boulder, on top of the car axle.
